title: allow remakes under a second condition
body:
If a player has not bought items, done zero damage, and has received zero experience points by 3:00, allow a remake.

This saves you from having to wait until 15 minutes if a player connects briefly and screws up the remake condition, but does absolutely nothing and sits in fountain

No, that would honestly be terrible. It's impossible to balance a bot to be used in multiplayer that would match your skill level. The bot would either be ABSOLUTE garbage, or so good that you could climb in low ELO just by having someone DC. Plus, I don't think it'd allow you to reconnect to the game very well if a bot controlled you.

I think if a player is AFK at any point for at least 7 minutes (or connected and just not doing anything) you should be able to vote to instantly end the game with the same majority rules as remake (2 votes). LP losses would be very slightly reduced but not by much (maybe 2-3 less LP lost). After all you shouldn't get rewarded for giving up.

Yeah, I think there needs to be LP changes in general. For the players that are doing well they should receive more LP for winning, and lose less LP when losing. And on the other side of the spectrum, players doing considerably worse, 2/10, 0/10 scores etc. should get less LP for winning, and lose more LP when losing. This is a team game, you win or lose as a team, but in return, a single person can bring that team down and players shouldn't be punished as much when this happens to them.

Too hard to judge that metric. The now somewhat popular 0/8 Sion strat that has taken 5 towers shouldn't be punished with lower LP gains right? This game isnt TDM. K/d/a means nothing in an objective focused game.
Modify it to be based on the same metrics which determine your letter rating at the end of the game maybe? That takes into account things like gold income, damage to objectives, healing, etc.

Also a clause that lets you remake if a player disconnects within the first 3 minutes. I don't hate the players, cause sometimes you have bad internet, or a crash or whatever. But having to 4v5 for 15 minutes without the chance to remake just because someone got DC'd sucks.
Could be handy, but I have faced situations more often, when players keep connecting and disconnecting every 2 minutes, and by this time they manage to reach the lane.

The point of remake isn't to deal with either trolls or these outlier cases (though I am assuming this is what you mean, cause I don't completely understand your example.) The point of Remake is that someone never connected at all, and so the others can get away.

Not to mention, how abuse-able this would be with premades. You could easily counter that with "Just punish all of them", but what happens if an actually legit version of this happens? Some friends get punished cause of one accident or something?

This wouldn't deal with trolls either, it would deal with the issue of people who *technically* connect to the match, but then something happens once they've loaded in and they finally dc, meaning even though they haven't left fountain, you can't remake because they were connected for > 0 seconds.

I can't really see how this could be abused? The things specified by OP require you to have done exactly nothing once the timer starts except possibly walk around in base a few seconds before disconnecting. Do please let me know what you're thinking though as I may just not have thought of it in the minute it took to write this.

A main thing with my comment, was that i just didn't understand their example. Here's the thing though, they were able to connect once, there's no reason why there isn't a chance they might reconnect again. Not connecting at all to the game, is a pretty good indicator that they might not be coming regardless. Someone who connects once, connected, and then something happened, I'd say there's reasonable chance that they might come back.

Despite all that, this still feels like a real outlier thing.
